text: After 27 Years, Kermit The Frog Is Getting A New Voice Enlarge this image toggle caption Tonya Wise / Invision / AP Tonya Wise / Invision / AP Television's most famous amphibian is set to get a new voice. Steve Whitmire, the puppeteer who for 27 years has performed as Kermit the Frog, is no longer voicing the green lead of the various Muppets TV programs and films, a spokesperson for The Muppets Studio confirmed to NPR. He will be replaced by longtime show veteran Matt Vogel. The spokesperson did not immediately comment on the reason for the switch. Whitmire, who first joined the Muppets in 1978, had served as the man behind the frog since the death of show creator Jim Henson in 1990
